title: Rollback blink/color utility classes to restore previous UI styling

requirements.summary: Remove the live blink icon animation by eliminating `icon-live-blink-2s` usage and disabling its CSS animation.
acceptanceCriteria: No icons blink anywhere in the UI (including scheme cards, header IT 2.0 icon, gallery icon, and floating buttons).
`icon-live-blink-2s` is no longer applied in React components, and the animation does not run in the browser.

file_operations.description: Remove (or fully disable) the `.icon-live-blink-2s` utility and its `@keyframes iconBlink2s` so no icon blinking animation can run.
Remove `icon-live-blink-2s` from the IT 2.0 header icon image so it no longer blinks.
Remove `icon-live-blink-2s` from scheme card icons and the hover-indicator arrow so they no longer blink.
Remove `icon-live-blink-2s` from the gallery card icon so it no longer blinks.
Remove `icon-live-blink-2s` from the gallery modal download icon overlay so it no longer blinks.
Remove `icon-live-blink-2s` from lightbox controls (download/prev/next icons) so they no longer blink.
Remove `icon-live-blink-2s` from the phone icon so the floating call button icon no longer blinks.
Remove `icon-live-blink-2s` from the WhatsApp icon so the floating WhatsApp button icon no longer blinks.
Remove `icon-live-blink-2s` from the IPPB card logo and hover-indicator arrow so they no longer blink.
Remove `icon-live-blink-2s` from the IPPB overlay header logo and category icons so they no longer blink.
Remove `icon-live-blink-2s` from copy/check icons so they no longer blink.

requirements.summary: Restore headings by removing `heading-primary-live` usage and disabling its forced dark-red/blink styling.
acceptanceCriteria: Section titles and modal titles do not blink.
Headings are not forced to the special dark-red heading color introduced by `heading-primary-live` and instead follow the base heading styles.

file_operations.description: Remove (or fully disable) the `.heading-primary-live` utility and its `@keyframes headingBlink2s` so headings are not forced dark-red and cannot blink.
Remove `heading-primary-live` from the IT 2.0 modal title so it uses base heading styles (no blink/no forced dark red).
Remove `heading-primary-live` from the scheme modal title so it uses base heading styles (no blink/no forced dark red).
Remove `heading-primary-live` from the gallery modal title so it uses base heading styles (no blink/no forced dark red).
Remove `heading-primary-live` from the IPPB overlay title so it uses base heading styles (no blink/no forced dark red).
Remove `heading-primary-live` from the testimonials section heading so it uses base heading styles (no blink/no forced dark red).
Remove `heading-primary-live` from the prompt section heading so it uses base heading styles (no blink/no forced dark red).

requirements.summary: Restore modal/overlay close (X) buttons by removing `close-x-live-blink-3s` usage and disabling its forced red/blink styling.
acceptanceCriteria: Close (X) icons in all dialogs/modals/lightboxes do not blink.
Close (X) icons are not forced to the special red color introduced by `close-x-live-blink-3s`.

file_operations.description: Remove (or fully disable) the `.close-x-live-blink-3s` utility and its `@keyframes closeBlink3s` so close icons are not forced red and cannot blink.
Remove `close-x-live-blink-3s` from the IT 2.0 modal close (X) icon so it uses the prior/base styling.
Remove `close-x-live-blink-3s` from the scheme modal close (X) icon so it uses the prior/base styling.
Remove `close-x-live-blink-3s` from the gallery modal close (X) icon so it uses the prior/base styling.
Remove `close-x-live-blink-3s` from the lightbox close (X) icon so it uses the prior/base styling.
Remove `close-x-live-blink-3s` from the BPM profile overlay close (X) icon so it uses the prior/base styling.

requirements.summary: Audit and revert any remaining blink/color-update helper utilities and references so the UI matches the pre-change version.
acceptanceCriteria: There are no remaining references to the rollbacked blink/color utilities in `frontend/src` (including CSS and component classNames).
The UI has no new blink-based effects compared to the previous version and behaves normally under `prefers-reduced-motion` (no special-casing needed for removed effects).

file_operations.description: Remove any leftover blink/color-update-only helpers and cleanup the `prefers-reduced-motion` block so it no longer references removed blink utilities (`icon-live-blink-2s`, `heading-primary-live`, `close-x-live-blink-3s`).

Run a local audit of composed components used by `App` (header, scheme grid/modals, gallery, profile overlay, floating buttons) and ensure no blink/color rollback classes remain referenced indirectly or via props/className composition.

Perform a project-wide audit within `frontend/src/components` to remove any remaining usages of rollbacked blink/color utilities in className strings and ensure the visual behavior matches the pre-change version without introducing new effects.
